page.title: 10Ellsborough Herd :Banbury
page.content: {Ells Farm} has been in the family for 70 years. They have got a {Fresian herd} because they are a good and strong breed. They breed their own replacements and they have two bulls. They have had a {pedigree} for four years. This means that they have kept records of their cows for ten years. For the first six years they record the details of the calves and their behaviour. Then they hand it in to the Fresian Society and if the book is good they get a pedigree. If they sell the cows then they can look in the book and tell them about each animal. They take the cows to market after 8 years when they stop milking but they have one that is 21 years old at the moment. They start milking at 06.00 and then again at 16.00. They give about 30 litres a day and there are {60 cows} in the herd. Claire Upton
